definition: to break (e.g. stick or bone)/a loss
to turn sth over/to turn upside down/to tip sth out (of a container)

to break/to fracture/to snap/to suffer loss/to bend/to twist/to turn/to change direction/convinced/to convert into (currency)/discount/rebate/tenth (in price)/classifier for theatrical scenes/to fold/accounts book
to fan/to slap sb on the face
fan/sliding, hinged or detachable flat part of sth/classifier for doors, windows etc

sentences.english: Modern clock inspired by the movement of Japanese folding fan.
sentences.chinese: 受日本折扇的转动所启发而制作的时尚时钟。

sentences.english: Sandalwood folding fans with quiet elegance and delicate fragrance give ladies real enjoyment.
sentences.chinese: 檀香折扇香气淡雅清郁，真正贵妇享受。

sentences.english: In addition, they can use giant folding fan to decorate their house and so on.
sentences.chinese: 此外，他们还可以使用巨型折扇来装饰他们的房子等。

sentences.english: on a single day recently she received a folding fan a necklace and a silk scarf.
sentences.chinese: 前几天她收到了一把折扇，一条项链和一条丝巾。

sentences.english: And she brought with her a big hand .
sentences.chinese: 她带回一把大大的折扇。

sentences.english: And she brought with her a big hand fan.
sentences.chinese: 她带回一把大大的折扇。

sentences.english: "We are going to bear the heat of summer with round paper fans and Japanese folding fans, " he said.
sentences.chinese: “我们将在夏天使用纸扇和日本折扇祛暑，”她说。

definition: long gown/cheongsam/traditional Asian dress for men or (in Hong Kong) women's qipao
